import React from "react"; export interface Props { titles: string[], descriptors: string[][], illustrations: JSX.IntrinsicElements, prefix: string } // Put arrow on selected tab =) class Tabs extends React.PureComponent{ rendered_page_index = 0; openProject = (id: number) => { this.rendered_page_index = id; } render() { console.log("got here"); const { titles, descriptors, illustrations, prefix } = this.props; const openProject = this.openProject; let tabs = []; let pages = []; let rendered_page; for (let i = 0; i < titles.length; i++) { tabs.push( ); } for (let i = 0; i < titles.length; i++) { pages.push(

{titles[i]}

{descriptors[i].map(paragraph =>

{paragraph}

)}
); } rendered_page = pages[this.rendered_page_index]; return (
{tabs} {pages}
); } } /*

Gesture recognition web application (Flask and tensorflow)

Developed during a 2 month period with a team of 3. You can check it out here
My teammates trained the model while I learned Flask and made a web application, front to back
It remains unfinished, some animations are missing and files can't yet be uploaded, but I'll come back to it with more experience.

Vaccination management system

A functioning app developped with Java that includes a graphical interface and a data management system.
I had a hand in the planning and design of the project, and wrote around 95% of the 2000 lines of code in it, plus documentation.
As requested by the teaching staff of that class, the code is private.
Currently on its last stage of development.

Counters

School project for object oriented programming with java; its a small window:

Using JavaFX, we (2 people) made a fancy window with 2 counters: you can add and substract, divide and
multiply, undo and redo, and export a .txt file with all registered operations
You can download the .zip of the project or you can see it on Github
Warning: it is in french

Pseudo-Lisp interpreter made with Haskell

Built the interpretation and evaluation section of a Haskell program that could read and execute files from a Lisp inspired language. Dealt with functions, closure, environments, variables, etc... the whole enchilada.

Pseudo-Haskell interpreter made with Prolog

Same thing, but this time it was a Haskell-inspired language and using Prolog for reading and executing.
Out of respect of the professor's code that compiled before our interpreter played any role, the code is private.
Currently on its last stage of development.

OOP Environment simulation made with Java

DISCLAIMER: The image presented is not from the project (the project only prints to the terminal).
It is merely illustrative and from a game called "Wild Lion Simulator 3D".

Using objected oriented programming we made an environmental simulation program.
It read XML files describing animals or plants and simulated them for a certain amount of epochs: the way they interacted,
what they ate, their energy consumption, whether they died or reproduced, and so on.

This website!

Made from scratch with html , css , javascript , jquery as well as the Animate on Scroll library. And a sprinkle of love!

*/ export default Tabs
